results.title: A Case of Angiotensin-Converting Enzyme (ACE) Inhibitor-Induced Small Bowel Angioedema
results.text_hl: We describe a rare case of a 58-year-old female with a history of @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@type 2 diabetes@@@ and @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ taking @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ for the past three years and presented with recurrent episodes of @DISEASE_Abdominal_Pain @DISEASE_MESH:D015746 @@@abdominal pain@@@, @DISEASE_Nausea @DISEASE_MESH:D009325 @@@nausea@@@, and @<m>DISEASE_Vomiting</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014839 @@@vomiting@@@ around the same time she started taking the drug.

citations.NLM: Pirzada S, Raza B, Mankani AA, Naveed B. A Case of Angiotensin-Converting Enzyme (ACE) Inhibitor-Induced Small Bowel Angioedema Cureus. 2023 Oct;15(10):e47739. PMID: 38022184
citations.BibTeX: @article{38022184, title={A Case of Angiotensin-Converting Enzyme (ACE) Inhibitor-Induced Small Bowel Angioedema}, author={Pirzada S and Raza B and Mankani AA and Naveed B}, journal={Cureus}, volume={15}, number={10}, pages={e47739}}

results.title: Type I Spontaneous Coronary Artery Dissection in a 33-Year-Old Male With Clinically Suspected Myopericarditis
results.text_hl: ., extreme Valsalva maneuver, retching, @<m>DISEASE_Vomiting</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014839 @@@vomiting@@@, coughing, or isometric exercise), use of stimulants, and hormonal triggers (e.g., pregnancy).

citations.NLM: Nisson C, Hernandez Mato Y, Lingappa N, Abraham J. Type I Spontaneous Coronary Artery Dissection in a 33-Year-Old Male With Clinically Suspected Myopericarditis Cureus. 2023 May;15(5):e38570. PMID: 37288237

results.title: A Gut Feeling: Isolated Small Bowel Angioedema due to Angiotensin-Converting Enzyme Inhibitor.
results.text_hl: Here, we present a case of @DISEASE_Angioedema @DISEASE_MESH:D000799 @@@visceral angioedema@@@ in a 32-year-old @SPECIES_9606 @@@woman@@@ who presented with @DISEASE_Pain @DISEASE_MESH:D010146 @@@left upper quadrant pain@@@, @DISEASE_Nausea @DISEASE_MESH:D009325 @@@nausea@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Vomiting</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014839 @@@vomiting@@@, @DISEASE_Diarrhea @DISEASE_MESH:D003967 @@@diarrhea@@@, and characteristic radiographic signs of small @DISEASE_Edema @DISEASE_MESH:D004487 @@@bowel angio-edema@@@, six months after starting @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@.

citations.NLM: Pinto MB, Vecchio M, Santos MA. A Gut Feeling: Isolated Small Bowel Angioedema due to Angiotensin-Converting Enzyme Inhibitor. R I Med J (2013). 2022 Aug 1;105(6):28-31. PMID: 35881996
citations.BibTeX: @article{35881996, title={A Gut Feeling: Isolated Small Bowel Angioedema due to Angiotensin-Converting Enzyme Inhibitor.}, author={Pinto MB and Vecchio M and Santos MA}, journal={R I Med J (2013)}, volume={105}, number={6}, pages={28-31}}

results.title: A Rare Cause of Abdominal Pain: Intestinal Angioedema
results.text_hl: The authors describe a case of a 28-year-old @SPECIES_9606 @@@woman@@@ medicated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ 2 months before, with @DISEASE_Abdominal_Pain @DISEASE_MESH:D015746 @@@abdominal pain@@@ associated with @DISEASE_Nausea @DISEASE_MESH:D009325 @@@nausea@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Vomiting</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014839 @@@vomiting@@@ and a onetime watery stool.

citations.NLM: Ferreira TA, Alves MR, Oliveira AMP, Silva FSS, Pereira C. A Rare Cause of Abdominal Pain: Intestinal Angioedema J Med Cases. 2021 Apr;12(4):138-140. PMID: 34434446
citations.BibTeX: @article{34434446, title={A Rare Cause of Abdominal Pain: Intestinal Angioedema}, author={Ferreira TA and Alves MR and Oliveira AMP and Silva FSS and Pereira C}, journal={J Med Cases}, volume={12}, number={4}, pages={138-140}}

results.title: ACE Inhibitor Induced Isolated Angioedema of the Small Bowel: A Rare Complication of a Common Medication
results.text_hl: She was managed conservatively, and @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ was discontinued.

citations.NLM: Squillante MD, Trujillo A, Norton J, Bansal S, Dragoo D. ACE Inhibitor Induced Isolated Angioedema of the Small Bowel: A Rare Complication of a Common Medication Case Rep Emerg Med. 2021;2021():8853755. PMID: 33628527
citations.BibTeX: @article{33628527, title={ACE Inhibitor Induced Isolated Angioedema of the Small Bowel: A Rare Complication of a Common Medication}, author={Squillante MD and Trujillo A and Norton J and Bansal S and Dragoo D}, journal={Case Rep Emerg Med}, volume={2021}, pages={8853755}}

results.title: Metformin Associated Lactic Acidosis in the Intensive Care Unit: A Rare Condition Mimicking Sepsis
results.text_hl: @GENE_BMP1 @GENE_649 @@@BMP@@@ was unremarkable a month ago when started on @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@.

citations.NLM: Sendil S, Yarlagadda K, Lawal H, Nookala V, Shingala H. Metformin Associated Lactic Acidosis in the Intensive Care Unit: A Rare Condition Mimicking Sepsis Cureus. 2020 Jul 10;12(7):e9119. PMID: 32699722

results.title: Post-marketing surveillance of lisinopril in general practice in the UK.
results.text_hl: @DISEASE_Cough @DISEASE_MESH:D003371 @@@Cough@@@, malaise and @DISEASE_Fatigue @DISEASE_MESH:D005221 @@@fatigue@@@, @DISEASE_Nausea @DISEASE_MESH:D009325 @@@nausea@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Vomiting</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014839 @@@vomiting@@@ were more frequent causes of withdrawal from @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ than @CHEMICAL_Nifedipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009543 @@@nifedipine@@@.

citations.NLM: Fallowfield JM, Blenkinsopp J, Raza A, Fowkes AG, Higgins TJ, Bridgman KM. Post-marketing surveillance of lisinopril in general practice in the UK. Br J Clin Pract. 1993 Nov-Dec;47(6):296-304. PMID: 8117550
citations.BibTeX: @article{8117550, title={Post-marketing surveillance of lisinopril in general practice in the UK.}, author={Fallowfield JM and Blenkinsopp J and Raza A and Fowkes AG and Higgins TJ and Bridgman KM}, journal={Br J Clin Pract}, volume={47}, number={6}, pages={296-304}}

results.title: Clinical Case Of the Month: A 35 Year Old Woman with Abdominal Pain.
results.text_hl: The @DISEASE_Joint_Loose_Bodies @DISEASE_MESH:D007594 @@@loose stools@@@ resolved spontaneously and then the @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ began to experience @DISEASE_Nausea @DISEASE_MESH:D009325 @@@nausea@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Vomiting</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014839 @@@vomiting@@@. Her medications included @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@-@CHEMICAL_Hydrochlorothiazide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006852 @@@hydrochlorothiazide@@@ which she had been taking for the past five months.

citations.NLM: Spera M, Thelin C, Gandolfi A, Clayton N, Nettles KM, Hagensee ME, Hutchings JJ, Lopez F. Clinical Case Of the Month: A 35 Year Old Woman with Abdominal Pain. J La State Med Soc. 2016 May-Jun;168(3):115-9. PMID: 27389384
